page.title: 18 FARMING
page.content:
Most of the permanent grassland is on the floodplain of the river, as it would be too wet for crops with the winter floodings.
There are no pig farms in our area. The mixed farms keep mostly either sheep (breeding ewes) or cattle mainly for beef. There were no cows for milking. Most of the farms kept some poultry, mainly hens but one kept geese to fatten for Christmas and one kept ducks.
Farms have less workers now because they have machines to do the work, machines are quicker and cheaper than men. The larger farms have their own combine harvesters, one farm even has two. All farms have at least one tractor with extra equipment.
